info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 15 at 5:40PM EDT until July 15 at 8:45PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Virginia, including the following county and independent cities, City of Roanoke, City of Salem and Roanoke.
* WHEN...Until 845 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 540 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Carvin Creek, Back Creek, Gum Spring Branch, Cook Creek, Horners Branch, Mason Creek, Buffalo Creek, Gish Branch and Coyner Branch. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Roanoke... Salem... Vinton... Cave Spring... Hollins... Roanoke Mountain... Cloverdale... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 PM EDT THIS EVENING

area.areaDesc: Roanoke, VA; City of Roanoke, VA; City of Salem, VA
